fact_list.fact_text: Parallel broken white lines indicate that traffic approaching these lines must give way to traffic on a major road.
Horizontal white line indicates that traffic is required to stop and must stop close to and before this line.
Parallel dashed or solid white lines indicate a designated crossing.
Turning vehicles must give way to pedestrians when the 'Green Man' is lighted.
At a zebra crossing, vehicles should slow down and stop if there are pedestrians or cyclists crossing or about to cross.
